answerText: Oscar Wilde[10] Wilde's best known drama may be this one in which Algernon Moncrieff refuses to consent to Jack's marriage to Gwendolen until Jack lets him marry Cecily; matters are complicated by both men creating stories about a man with the titular name.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 6 | 20 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This author wrote about Mrs. Cheevely, who attempts to blackmail Robert Chiltern into voting for a fraudulent canal scheme in Argentina, in his play An Ideal Husband.  For 10 points each: [10] Name this author who created the character of Lord Illingworth, who had fathered Gerald with Lady Arbuthnot, in his play A Woman of No Importance.
